alert.note: Alert for Lake; Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 22 at 6:11PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following counties, Lake and Volusia. * WHEN...Until 815 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 610 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... DeLand, Eustis, Mount Dora, Paisley, Cassia, Mount Plymouth, Pittman, Sorrento, Umatilla, Lake Kathryn, Fullerville, Lake Dorr, Alexander Springs, Forest Hills, Lake Mack-Forest Hills, Pine Lakes, Altoona, Lake Woodruff, Sellers Lake and Astor Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
